Author: 28 August 2004
Review_Url: this is a great movie with no flaws (my opinion of course) also the performances were impeccable. although no awards or nominations were given it was still great. this is a movie you can watch over and over again. and still laugh every time. but this movie is not for some people like those who are contradictical of bowling, drugs, kidnappings, crime or nudity, it received and deserved it's r rating. that statement is mabey the only negativity i'll do on such a great film. but to e honest i almost didn't see this, on account of i thought it would be completely different, and because of no nominations of any awards, but this movie actually has made me think outside of the box for movies why else would i see malibu's most wanted.

Author: 20 November 2011
Review: Neither the best nor the worst.....
Review_Url: Excuse me all of you who loved this movie....I really don't understand what the hype is all about....... I'm sorry but.....allow me pinpoint some aspects.....Is the movie funny? Yeah, a little... it shows a lot of acid humor and sarcasm , which by the way I love....Otherwise, the movie lacks of consistency. or let me say, a spinal cord...it has great specific moments of excellence....although is not enough for pasting all of them into a unique brightness piece..... The storyline in general is poor...in my opinion.....sometimes I felt as if the movie has just stopped..... Look Burn after reading for instance.....it's the most great movie of Coen brothers.....I loved it!!! The main characters are great in The big Lebowski despite of their just passable interaction ....highlighting Jesus, who was by far my favorite character...appealing, flashy, arrogant and clueless at the same time... On the background I've enjoyed the subject, specially the greed, which is continuously at our side all the time.... live, and see how petty and greedy people are.... Bottom line, if you are looking for a deep and dense experience under Coen's label, this is not the right movie, try No place for old country, Fargo or mainly Burn after reading.

Author: 8 December 2011
Review_Url: I recommended this movie to a friend of mine and he asked me what kind of movie it was. I answered; "it's the best movie ever made" "Why?" he asked and I answered; "why not?" Seriously, why not? It has the most amazing characters, you can pick your favorite sure, but non of them sucks, and they are all played brilliantly. It has the most amazing dialogs, everything that is said in this movie is just so brilliant, if you don't agree, then, that's just, like, your opinion, man. It has the most amazing story, it's both strange and interesting, and the way it's told keeps your eyes on the screen the whole time. I've probably seen this movie about 20 times now, and I enjoy it every time, every god damn time it's brilliant and mind-blowing and funny, and enjoyable and etc. So I ask again, why is it not the best movie ever made? why, the hell, is The big Lebowsky, not the best, movie, ever, made?

Author: 30 January 1999
Review_Url: The Big Lebowski is one of the very few comedies that actually gets better every time you watch it.  The characters are some of the best to ever be created in movie making history: The Dude, Walter, Donny, Jesus Quintana, and the Nihilists.  There are about (total) 20 slow minutes in the movie, and the rest of it is absolutely hilarious.  John Goodman's performance as Walter is Oscar material, and definitely my favorite character of any movie I've ever seen, from giving his choice words to Donny to relating just about everything that happens to Vietnam.  The conversations at the bowling alley are classics.  In 1998, I saw two of the best comedies I've ever seen: There's Something About Mary, and The Big Lebowski, and The Big Lebowski wins hands down.  I'll just leave you with this:

Author: 21 April 2007
Review_Url: This was the movie that brought me round to Jeff Bridges the actor. He always annoyed me before with his pompous type characters but in this he is superb. He made me laugh constantly throughout the movie. I always loved the Coen's work as it is just beautifully shot and conceived - always interesting without moving too far from the joy of the story. The Big Lebowski is my favourite Coen movie because it deals with a more common theme and is easy to relate to. Jeff Bridges character I could watch all day and sometimes I wish there could be a follow up movie. The story is full of superb characters and settings, whilst the soundtrack is excellent. Do yourself a favour and see this film.

Author: 21 December 1998
Review: Once again, the Cohen Brothers kick ass!!
Review_Url: The Big Lebowski is yet another great film by the Coen brothers.  It's not quite as entertaining as "Fargo" or "Barton Fink", but it will not disappoint.  (In my opinion, the worst of their films towers above all the mediocre crud that's out there).  The dreamy bowling sequences were hilariously brilliant and most of the actors involved were excellent.  John Goodman, however,  was slightly annoying, and not nearly as effective as he was in "Barton Fink".  John Turturo was also great in a small role as Jesus the bowler.  See this film...

Author: 5 March 2001
Review_Url: The finest most original film makers in Hollywood bring us yet another classic movie.

Author: 17 July 2001
Review: Brilliant Comedy on par with Annie Hall and Dr. Strangelove
Review_Url: *WARNING minor spoilers* The Big Lebowski, virtually ignored by the mainstream and a relative commercial failure, is the Coen Brother's most hilariously clever comedy to date. The film combines the best of slapstick, hilarious dialogue, extremely well-drawn and complex characters, an excellent plot, and social commentary of the highest calibur to create perhaps the best comedy of all time. Jeff Bridges is absolutely brilliantly lazy in his quasi-passive burnt-out character, while John Goodman provides perhaps one of the most impressive performances as a shafted disgruntled reactionary "'Nam" veteran. John Turturro provides the most immediately up-front hilarious character as a bowling 'paedharass', Jesus Quintana: "That's right, Nobody f***s with the Jesus!" I've watched this movie four or five times to date, and have yet to grow wary of the virtual infinity of perfectly repeatable lines. And if you are offended by incessant swearing, well, all I can say is: "You are entering a world of pain."

Author: 2 July 2001
Review: Insane "film noirish" comedy thriller from the ever reliable Coen brothers
Review_Url: Insane "film noirish" comedy thriller from the ever reliable Coen brothers.

Author: 17 April 2019
Review: Lots of moving parts & information will come to light...........
Review_Url: When you set out to relax and forget about your mostly miserable life,this is the type of entertainment you should seek. The characters are superbly portrayed & the story written perfectly for them. So many great things I could say, but I don't really like typing soooo, just watch the masterpiece and rate it 10 stars here when your surfing the web looking for ,for, nothing. Remember, tune in-turn on-drop out-culture is not your friend and its just a ride..........

Author: 23 June 2006
Review: Sometimes, there's a man... that man is The Dude.
Review_Url: It took me a few views before I fully appreciated all the subtleties of this film. Beyond being humorous from both a character and a situational point of view, it has a near genius way of combining the extraordinary with the mundane, putting The Dude in a situation which he does not fit into at all. The outrageous exploits of just about every other character, including the Dude's friend Walter and his rich and powerful counterpart, also named Jeff Lebowski, are made even more outrageous in the fact that the Dude just wants to lay back, smoke a joint, and not get involved in any of this.

Author: 29 September 2002
Review_Url: This is the Coen Brothers at their very best and it is hard to believe they will ever be able to top this one, which I see as at least at a par with their critically acclaimed "Fargo". This is easily the funniest and most quotable movie I've ever seen and it is still wonderfully entertaining after many, many viewings. The cast is perfect - Jeff Bridges and John Goodman arguably gave the performances of their careers to date in this movie. The only reason I could see why people could have problems with this fine work is the language, which does not exactly adhere to the commonly accepted concept of good manners. If you don't mind that, this movie is a definite must see. Great idea for a fun evening: go bowling first and then watch the Big Lebowski with a couple of 'Caucasians'. 10 out of 10, and yes, it really tied the room together, did it not?

Author: 7 August 2002
Review: The Best Comedy Ever Made and one which I could watch forever, dude!
Review_Url: This movie is the reason why movies are made.  It is fun, funny and yet carries a message with it of dire consequences for ones actions.  Though set in the time of operation desert storm, the jokes, punchlines, anecdotes and characters are not dated one bit, and neither are the reacurring references of politics, lingo and expresssions like "chinaman", "nialist", "johnson" or "dude".  I never thought the word dude could be personified into so many different verbs, adjectives or nouns, that a simple story involving a kidnapping mixed with bowling could be so complex with so many different characters yet be so intricately structured that it is still simple to comprehend, with every character uniquely created while still commanding multiple viewings.  The character of the Dude, based on a friend of the Cohen brothers, is expertly played by Jeff Bridges as a simple stoner who loves White Russians, bowling and is overwhelmed by all the attention suddenly paid to his quiet existence by a chance of mistaken identity. His friends are the hilarious John Goodman playing a divorced converted Jew who frequently references "'Nam" in inappropriate instances, repeatedly asks "Am I wrong?" in an attempt to justify his actions and still acts like a soldier past him prime, pulling guns and uzis out to keep the world sane.  Steve Buschemi, John Tutturo and Philip Seymour Hoffman both offer hilarious quips, questions, quotations and funny accents to add to the insanity. Add in Julian Moore and Tara Reid in early yet believable performances and a masterpiece is formed.  Every piece of dialogue is a quotable quote, every scene is expertly woven, every character is well structured and every joke is fully explored.  Theres no dumb pot humour here, only intelligent jokes with some of the best physical abuse comedy ever set to the music of Creedence Clearwater, Bob Dylan's 'The Man in Me', Kenny Roger's 'What Condition my Condition was in' and the Eagles 'Hotel California' in Spanish. This is not only the best bowling movie ever made, the best Cohen brother movie ever made, and the best comedy ever made, it is also one of the best if not the best movie ever made and it only gets better every time you watch it.  The phrase may be cliched but this movie is the one that made it so. And if you see one movie for the rest of your life, make it this one. 11/10

Author: 28 June 2002
Review: Put simply, a marvellous film and a must see
Review_Url: To say this film is a masterpiece is perhaps a little generous, however, it is not far off.  The Big Lebowski is a tribute to the real people out there; people trying to get through life exerting the shortest amount of effort necessary whilst drifting in and out of trouble.  I think this sums up the film perfectly.  I've watched this film so many times and I still can't find anything wrong with it.

Author: 14 April 2019
Review_Url: Has some mildly funny moment, but no laugh-out-loud bits.

Author: 9 July 2019
Review_Url: Great movie. I've seen it many times, and every time I'm bouncing. Congratulations to all involved in the production of this movie.

Author: 17 April 2020
Review: One of the worst movies I've ever seen!
Review_Url: The film is extremely tiring, with dialogues without any content and I only managed to have a laugh at the whole film ... One of the most highly esteemed films of all time, those who watch will understand what I'm talking about

Author: 12 June 2013
Review: The perfect relaxing film, hiding a deep philosophy
Review_Url: The Big Lebowski, yet another absolutely perfect masterpiece of a film from the Coen Brothers. These brothers seem to be masters at the medium of film. Every single line of dialogue in this movie has a way of being seen as funny, even if you can find a line in the film that isn't very obviously comedic. The film is genius in the way that through all it's seeming simplicity, through all that it seems to focus on the ridiculous plight of a stoner attempting to solve a mystery, it harbors a deep philosophy, a sort of live and let live philosophy. In other words, the Dude Abides. The three main performances, those of John Goodman, Jeff Bridges, and Steve Buscemi, are expertly played, as are the majority of the roles, including Philip Seymour Hoffman, Julianne Moore, and John Turturro. Also, the music in the film, as some people have pointed out, is much like a character in the film. And it just 'fits right in there' to quote the Stranger. The movie is fantastically rewatchable. One could probably watch it once a day and not grow weary of it, because it's incredibly funny, quotable, and genius.

Author: 14 September 2019
Review_Url: I watched this with my Dad and it was absolutely hilarious, and I know the Coen brothers always rate this #1 but I thought it was a little bit sexual so I wouldn't recommend it for small children!

Author: 30 July 2003
Review_Url: after viewing "the dude" at least 30 times, i must say it has taken a zen-like quality.  all the mysteries of life can be explained by "the dude."   the film is the beginning, the middle, and the end.

Author: 12 February 2007
Review: This...this is not a worthy adversary...
Review_Url: This is a film that is hard to describe. When anyone asks what it's about, I just say, "The Dude".

Author: 15 March 2017
Review_Url: Review: 'The Big Lebowski' 'The Big Lebowski' by the Coen brothers is a great film because of its great characters. The cast includes Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, Julianne Moore, John Turturro and many more. 'The Big Lebowski' released in 1998 is a quirky crime comedy about an unemployed slacker from L.A who is drawn into a world of kidnapping after being mistaken for a washed up millionaire of the same name. To summarize it 'The Big Lebowski' is about 'The Dude' a slacker and a keen bowler, when two enforcers show up at his house demanding money, having mistook him for a millionaire with the same name and urinating on his carpet, he is plunged into a world of deceit, kidnapping and much more in the pursuit to be compensated for his ruined carpet. A summary of the plot does not do this film justice. The character of 'The Dude' is brought to life by the outstanding performance of Jeff Bridges. The dude has so many hilarious quotes and back and forths with his counterpart 'Walter' played by John Goodman. Jeff Bridges seamlessly plays 'The Dude' with laid back perfection. I was disappointed though with Steve Buscemi's character 'Donny' having very few lines in the film although whenever he does talk he is usually told to shut up which can be quite funny. Another film by the Coen brothers called 'Fargo' has Steve Buscemi in a much bigger role than in this one and he is excellent in 'Fargo'. I would have preferred if he was given a bigger role like in 'Fargo'. John Turturro has a hilarious performance as 'Jesus' but little screen time. During the film's spectacular dream sequences are used with great effect. The soundtrack for the film is very good too. In conclusion 'The Big Lebowski' is more about the characters than the plot. I would recommend this film too everyone and I would give it a 9/10. It is my favourite Coen brothers' film and my favourite film with Jeff Bridges in it that I have seen.

Author: 8 September 2008
Review: A celebration of the ultimate man
Review_Url: It's easily better than Fargo, IMHO, and it's right up there with Barton Fink or Miller's Crossing. A true comedy classic with so many memorable lines and characters, but it's the movie's atmosphere which is so truly joyous, a wonderful celebration of basically doing nothing. Achieving one's goals is important, yes, but it's okay to set them low, is what I perceived this movie to be saying. As long as one is basically a good guy, then that's enough. Well, that's what it seemed like to me, and it was expressed so beautifully in the stunning cast of grotesques, lovely music ( although more Burwell would have been nice ), and the trippiest, funniest, most absurd dream sequences you've ever seen. If you're a type A personality, you might not like this movie much, but for the type B's, and further on down the alphabet, (the further the better) Great Movie!

Author: 24 July 2000
Review_Url: Of all the films on my shelf, this is the one I watch the most. Every moment of The Big Lebowski is a gem. Bridges and Goodman are hilariously funny. The only real flaw is a somewhat unengaging plot, but in the company of The Dude and Walter, you hardly even notice. The Coens really are the greatest living filmmakers.

Author: 7 June 2000
Review_Url: When a director does such a masterpiece as "Fargo", it's very unlikely that he will repeat the same level of excellence in his next film. With "The Big Lebowski", the Coen brothers not only did a good movie, but a truly excellent comedy. I was laughing so hard when I saw this movie that I almost cried. I have seen it three times now and the impact is always huge, it's hilarious. It's also smart, full of quotable lines and remarks, and gripping to the very end... in fact I was enjoying it so much that I didn't want it to end! The characters are memorable, and all the actors do a magnificent job, but John Goodman steals the movie, to me it's his best film ever. A must see!

Author: 26 September 2004
Review_Url: ...and, without question, the greatest movie ever made. Enough said, I think, but the site requires at least ten lines. So here are ten lines...

Author: 24 April 2002
Review: Absolutely nailed by the Coens (and Bridges).
Review_Url: Similar to the measured brilliance of Fargo, the Coen Brothers, Joel and Ethan, again delivered a perfectly structured and aimed tribute to the slacker in all of us.

Author: 12 February 2007
Review_Url: Amazing!Finally a movie that makes you feel stoned as opposed to wishing you were stoned to enjoy it(Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas,the entire Cheech and Chong recorded output)Genius moment #1.During the dude's blackout sequence after being slipped a mickey by Jackie Treehorn he's dressed like Karl Hungus in the porno movie he sees in Maude's apartment.Genius moment #2.Little Larry never utters a single word during the most inept interrogation scene ever filmed."You're killing your father Larry".Genius Moment #3."...And I a'int never see no queen in her damned undies" and every other line uttered by Ramblin'Sam Elliott in this out and out classic that even the Greenpoint hipsters and sport reporting steaks who quote it bible and verse can't tarnish.

Author: 8 July 1999
Review_Url: I was very disappointed. I really liked Fargo, and so many people I know had such good comments on this film, but I find it just dumb and somewhat predictable.

Author: 17 May 2020
Review: One of the worst movies I had ever seen!
Review_Url: It's not a comedy or sport or even anything it's the worst movie i had ever seen in my life it's not funny or anything it's not even a movie

Author: 12 April 2004
Review_Url: I understand that this movie is not for everybody, i had to also watch it two times before i started to like it. But when you are hooked, you really are hooked. I can't think of a funnier movie than this, the dialogues are simple but great!!! Only wish they would make a special edition DVD from this one, Joel and Ethan Coen really made their best film with this one. All the characters are unique, the dude is awesome played by Jeff Bridges. Simply my all time favorite movie

Author: 19 December 2006
Review_Url: There's one big reason I like "the dude" better than so many other films. While Lebowsky has his share of flaws, they aren't really the cause of his problems. It's simply stirs from a case of mistaken identity. And I think people can sympathize with him so much more for that.

Author: 3 April 2020
Review: Wasting of time in the worst possible way
Review_Url: The worst movie I ever watched in decade!! Disgusting, meaningless!! How the high rating made me fool I wonder!

Author: 13 January 2019
Review: A really good movie but kind of confusing
Review_Url: The Big Lebowski is a really good film. It folows the adventure of the dude (mr Lebowski) trying to get back his rug. With his two freinds that are also his bowling partners. The movie never slows down to explain it all, but instead slows down during the dialogue. For me i really liked this because of how interesting it is. There is almost never a dull moment in the film. Basically what the one gripe i have with the film is there isnt really a payoff. Sure thats fine sometimes, but with all that had happend it kind of seemed weird not to have one. Still though it doesn't change the whole movie and its score. So i give it 8/10 and a recommendation aswell.

Author: 26 February 2020
Review_Url: While I'm writing this in 2020 as an 18-year old, my favourite movie is still the same one as it was when I first saw The Big LeBowski when I was about 12. Back then I just thought it was hilarious, but when I took a closer look in the years after I came to realise that the dude works in mysterious ways.

Author: 12 December 2004
Review_Url: I found that while I liked certain parts of the film and found the acting excellent. It just seemed uneven in pace and plot...

Author: 14 March 2002
Review_Url: Wouldn't it be great to see a sequel to THE BIG LEBOWSKI. We could revisit Walter and Jeffrey's L.A. However, there would be no Donny... I didn't like seeing Donny go. The Coens could make a Lebowski that sets in today, instead of the 90ies. Hope the Dude still obides.

Author: 28 January 2004
Review: Another gem from the Coen brothers
Review_Url: I'm not sure if I can add to what's already written. This is just a great comedy. The interactions between Goodman and Buscemi make it worth the price of the rental. Fantastic characters as usual (if John Turturro's Jesus doesn't make you laugh, you're probably clinically dead).

Author: 4 January 2016
Review_Url: This is a plot and dialogue that perhaps only the Coen Brothers could have devised. I'm thinking less of their clarity in "Fargo" and "No Country for Old Men" than of the almost hallucinatory logic of "Raising Arizona" and "The Hudsucker Proxy." Only a steady hand in the midst of madness allows them to hold it all together--that, and the delirious richness of their visual approach.

Author: 9 March 2004
Review_Url: I just bought The Big Lebowski on DVD and boy, had I forgotten how hilarious it was! I hadn't seen it since it was in the theatres 5 1/2 years ago, and I had forgotten how great some of those lines were. So many little details, like the 69 cent check for the half and half to commiting ones ashes to the "bosom of the Pacific". Every Coen brothers movie before and after this one has rocked, but this one still remains the best and easily the funniest. I know that the Coen's are fond of George Clooney right now, but it would great to bring back Jeff Bridges for another role as well as John Goodman. They made a great team. Everytime I watch this movie henceforth, I will be "adhering to a strict drug regimen to keep my mind limber."

Author: 4 March 2004
Review_Url: If only I could count how many times this film has been able to cheer me up, I could probably only then begin to thank the Coen brothers for this gem of a film.  Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, and John Turturro fit perfectly into their characters while a stellar cast of supporting actors (Steve Buscemi, Julianne Moore, Sam Elliot) give quirky and hilarious performances.  The script is possibly the best coen script to date.  I know there was a backlash when this was first released with people looking for Fargo 2 but in my opinion this is the better film. Ten out of ten in my opinion, but for those who are offended by a few hundred curse words I suggest you steer clear of this one and rent...i don't know...goldmember or something. Anyway, see it or dont see it either way the dude will continue to abide.

Author: 2 June 2021
Review_Url: It is an ok movie, neither interesting nor funny. Just for killing 90 minutes. This film might be amusing to 10-year-olds.

Author: 25 December 2000
Review_Url: This is one of those great movies you run across from time to time that isn't trying to be a 4 star classic, it's just trying to make people laugh...and that it did! This is a great movie to watch at a party or even by yourself. Unique feel good comedy!

Author: 28 September 2004
Review_Url: Cash Converters has thrown up some real gems in its time, but The Big Lebowski is without doubt the best Â£2 I have ever spent in my life. Once again the Coens showed their undoubted genius which, if I had my way, would result in the bestowing of an honorary knighthood upon both of them. And if I know our queeny, which I'm sure I think I do, then one look at the Dude, Walter and Donny and the decision would be made for her. Unfortunately I would imagine that snapped up the only copy ever to be seen in the Converters (what fool sold this? Put him in the stocks!), so she might have to splash out a bit more than I did.

Author: 18 March 2007
Review_Url: This may just be the perfect movie. The Big Lebowski, though it may have a dull plot, has perfect acting by all the colorful, well-portrayed characters. Every scene is a tribute to greatness, from the very beginning, to the very end. Even though it came out nearly ten years ago, it has still yet to be matched by another comedy. I've found that it is a seriously underrated movie. Shadowed by mediocre comedies like Wedding Crashers and Talladega Nights, it has amassed a gigantic cult following. For good reason, too. It is flawlessly directed, flawlessly casted, and flawlessly acted. Despite it's irreverence and relentless profanity, it actually has an almost touching ending. Definitely a classic movie. Probably my all-time fav. ten out of ten.

Author: 12 January 2002
Review: A hilarious celebration of the mundane
Review_Url: An extremely funny and original movie directed by the Coen brothers.  The usual suspects appear:  Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, John Turturro.  Each play weird and wonderful characters caught in mundane lives of their own choosing.  Until Jeff"The Dude" Lebowski (Bridges) meets his nemesis..

Author: 7 October 2006
Review_Url: i enjoyed watching this movie and i have to say it is just a good movie.it definitely falls into the category of "must see films" due to its very awakening dialogs and its great players. without too much talking about it, i give it 2 thumbs up and if i had more rest a sure they would be up too. a lovely film about one dude who finds him self in the wrong place at the wrong time. Steve Buschmi is great as always, John Goodman gives his thoughts to the situation. and Jeff Bridges in one of his great rolls - as the dude. any one who likes this type of movies will not only see this movie, he will buy an original DVD of the movie to keep in the house. i have seen it at least ten times threw out the years. you never get tired from it.

Author: 26 May 2003
Review_Url: They don't come any better/funnier than this! Perhaps my fav. film of all time!!! These guys are masters at making entertaining intelligent funny movies. I just wish they could make a Big L II..even though I usually loathe sequels!!

Author: 20 November 2006
Review: Your revolution is over Mr. Lebowski!
Review_Url: I've lost count of how many times I've seen this film and each time it seems to get better and better. Yet, the first time I saw this film I didn't think it was a great movie since I didn't realize the true greatness of it (in fact, I think no one did). This is because the movie is not about the plot or about the message. This movie is great because of its characters, dialogue and aesthetics, things that are most appreciated with successive viewings. It's the little details that will make this your favourite comedy of all time.

Author: 19 May 2003
Review: one of the funniest movies ever
Review_Url: This is one of the funniest movies I have ever seen and i never get bored of watching it again and again.The great acting between the three main characters, Goodman, Bridges and Buscemi,is 100% pure fun to watch. Even if Buscemi does not say that much he gives his part a memorable performance.All the other actors who have small parts are hilarious. Take Turturro for example who plays a latino bowling player named Jesus with such perfect acting so I canÂ´t help laughing.So if youÂ´re looking for a very twisted and well played comedy this is the one to see. This picture will make you feel really good.DonÂ´t miss the burial scene.

Author: 13 October 2003
Review_Url: If you're a Coen Bros. fan, run, do not walk, and get yourself a copy of this movie.  There are some movies I can watch more than once, and this is one of them.  There are so many laughs in this flick, you pick up something new with each viewing.  Am I wrong?

Author: 28 November 2013
Review_Url: The Big Lebowski's beginning monologue was enough to make me want to sit down and forget about everything so I can watch the movie in its entirety. The dialogue, although filled with the F word, sounded genuine, coming from real people in real situations. The acting seemed so natural that it was on par with movies like the Godfather. I can watch the movie several times and see something new simply because of the acting. There is no one who can play the dude better than Jeff Bridges. The role was made for him.

Author: 10 June 2020
Review_Url: The story of "The Big Lebowski" felt very chaotic while watching. Sometimes I could not see a common theme in the story, and that is probably what made it a bit boring at a certain point for me.

Author: 13 August 1998
Review: #1 Comedy of 1998 (with the possible exception of "something about mary")
Review_Url: How could anybody compare this movie to Fargo?  They are completely different movies, each amazing in diffrent ways.  I've seen Fargo over 20 times and Lebowski 6 times and I still couldn't tell you which one is better but i can tell you they don't lose anything after multiple viewings.  They both prove that the Coen brothers may be the best moviemakers in Hollywood today.  Lebowski is one of the few movies I've ever walked out of and wanted to walk right back in and watch it again.  I recomend this movie for anyone and everyone.

Author: 27 July 2000
Review: It's really hard to get enough of this film
Review_Url: Speaking as a guy who like his art film, including Ingmar Bergman works and the more heady Coen Brothers films, please believe me when I say I would not expect to like a movie with such low-life urban American characters and swearing.

Author: 13 August 2001
Review: They peed on your f***ing rug
Review_Url: The Big Lebowski is one of those movies that I didn't love the first time I saw it, but now that I have seen it 20+ times, I love it.  Now, just the thought of watching it makes me laugh.  I am laughing while I am putting it in the DVD player, and I am laughing now as I think about Jeff Bridges playing detective all of a sudden and finding a cartoon picture of a man with an enormous penis on the pad that Jackie Treehorn had scribbled on.  I mean come on, is this not cinematic genius?  Whatever the reasons, this film just gets better the more times you see it; similar in that regard to "Office Space."  This is one of the funniest movies I have ever seen.

Author: 27 December 2018
Review: Unique and brilliant in its own way
Review_Url: One of the coen brothers greatest movies, focusing on Jeff "the dude" Lebowski, usually mistaken for a millionaire with the same name who's wife owes money around town.

Author: 5 May 2007
Review_Url: When I first happened upon this movie I did not yet know what I was getting into. I knew the makers by their previous works but was not yet a fan. The first time I saw it I didn't understand what was going on. The second time I watched it I knew the plot and could therefore concentrate on the subtleties. That is what makes this film greatness. The Big Lebowski is a shining example of what film should be, a perfect marriage of superior quality writing and heart-felt acting from the masters of their respective professions, with an attention to detail unlike any other. Materials of the finest quality mature with age and stand the test of time. This film never gets old and only improves with each sequential viewing the way summer block-busters never can. Take a chance. Give this one another look. Invest ninety minutes of your life into this film.

Author: 19 December 2001
Review_Url: This movie is so fun to watch. The Coen brothers are magicians with dialogue and characters. I love their style of film-making and writing. This film, like many of their films, is very character-driven. A great soundtrack and some great cinematography round out this effort. This film gets quoted by my friends and I as much as any film there is. If you get a chance, go rent this Coen Classic right now, as a matter of fact, get them all.

Author: 4 July 2002
Review_Url: If the movie were a car it would be a finely crafted Rolls-Royce. More technically it is a very efficient film: I couldn't identify a single boring or irrelevant minute. The casting is superb: Jeff Bridges down-at-heels bum is in perfect contrast to John Goodman's up-tight Vietnam veteran with Steve Buscemi perfectly in between. The constellation colourful and entertaining characters is another feature of the film: the Dude's wierd landlord (into strange amateur dance routines), the militant feminist played by Juliana Moore, the sycophantic personal assistant played by whatshisname Hoffman (played George in Scent of a woman, the gang of nihilists, the porn king, the bimbo kidnapee and - topping them all - the sexually perverted bowler player called (blasphemically) Jesus. If these characters didn't even interact - I mean if there was not plot at all to the movie - it would still be fun to watch them from hours on end just doing everyday things.

Author: 20 March 2003
Review: F*ck it Dude, let's go bowling.
Review_Url: What to say about this film that hasn't already been guessed at?? The story comes in and out of a period in Jeffrey Lebowski's (The Dude) life and shows the ease with which he gets himself into ridiculous situations.

Author: 8 July 2010
Review_Url: When I saw this movie, the next day, my brother asked me if I liked it... And I said him Yeah... Okey, why? Asked again him. And I said, I can't tell you, you have to see it. Only if you see it you'll understand.

Author: 10 October 2004
Review: The greatest movie ever made about a rug
Review_Url: From the infamous Coen brothers, comes a movie so fresh and original that one must wonder what they were thinking when the concept for this film sparked.

Author: 10 July 2006
Review: Another Brilliant, Twisted Film from the Coen Brothers
Review_Url: The Coen brothers are known for a bizarre sense of humor as are their fans and once again they hit the nail on the head with this film.

Author: 23 July 1999
Review: One of my favorites ...all time classic to be
Review_Url: Well , when i first saw it I missed many parts or little details which made this masterpiece so much funnier , the characters introduced are so unique and original I was really impressed.. Maybe because this was my first Coen/Coen movie it hit me hard.

Author: 29 August 2001
Review: No, Dude, we don't mind if you do a J...
Review_Url: It's the little things about a Coen-constructed universe (read "film") that make me laugh, and "Lebowski" is no exception.

Author: 6 April 1999
Review_Url: Some critics didn't like this movie, accusing it of "being inconsistent", of "having no plot" and of "talking about nothing". I think they are the sort of people that praised pathetic, boring movies like The Thin Red Line or Spielberg's latest epic. Lebowski is the best Coen movie ever. In a plot that is essentially a bizarre version of The Big Sleep, the Coens throw in some amazing characters like the L.A. slacker "Dude", the half-crazy Vietnam veteran, the Dude's pathetic landlord, Jesus, the "Nihilists" and the result is absolutely brilliant. The heroes (or should I say idiots) of the movie have the unique ability to screw up everything they are trying to do, from a simple investigation to the shaking of Donny's ashes in the end. The surreal dream sequences demonstrate the Coen brothers' virtuosity. I laughed from the beginning to the end of the movie. Lebowski is one of the funniest and most original movies of the decade. Ten out of ten.

Author: 10 March 1999
Review_Url: This movie is my fav. movie in the world!!!! It may be pointless, but it's great and in my opinion reflects life, if you look closely. Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, Steve B., and all the rest just do a great job at acting there roles. The only bad part was it ended!!!!!

Author: 26 January 2000
Review: I was talking about my rug...
Review_Url: I'm going to be daring.  I shall court with controversy.  I have a terrible feeling that I will not escape with my artistic integrity (such as it is) intact.  The Big Lebowski is the Coens finest achievement.  There.  I've said it - and will now wait for the inevitable aftermath.  But Why?

Author: 12 February 2010
Review_Url: Does this film, Big Lebowski, presage the 911 Tragedy even though it was produced in 1998, 3 years before the tragedy? If it does, what does that imply ?

Author: 18 October 1999
Review_Url: The more I watch this movie the more I enjoy it.  That is a statement that can be made for almost all of the Cohen brother's films.  John Goodman gives his best performance ever.  The over the top performance by Philip Seymour Hoffman was right on and overlooked.  This guy always steals the scene no matter what movie he's in.  (Except Twister which no one could have saved.) When I first heard Jeff Bridges was doing a Cohen brothers film I was kind of surprised but he did a good and convincing job as the Dude.  A give this film a 9.  By the way I got in an argument with my friend over the Cohens. Here is how I rank their films.

Author: 11 June 2001
Review_Url: What can i say about this film. ive recently watched it on video. ive watched fargo and that was the main reason why i purchased this movie. i thought the coen brothers have a gift and wondered if this same gift is used in this movie. in my opinion this is probably better than fargo. steve buscemi and john goodman are absolutely hilarious in this movie. especialy when donnie says one word in a conversation with a quick reply of 'shut the f##k up donnie' from goodman. but lets not take any thing away from jeff bridges who as the 'dude' is so good at being so chilled makes me laugh. the dream sequences made me crack up as well with jeff or the 'dude' doing his little dance down those huge steps. all in all a pleasure to watch one of my top 10 movies. 'well at least im house broken'

Author: 17 February 2011
Review_Url: Man, do I love this movie. I've seen it a few times, and it gets better with each viewing. Jeff Bridges character is one that could not have been played better by anyone - this is one of those roles that seems so perfect, so real, that it will forever define the actor who played it. Jeff Bridges will always be "The Dude".

Author: 14 April 2002
Review_Url: What can I say? This is one of my favourite films to date. The Coen brothers have done it again; have they ever made a bad film? Well Barton fink was odd but still not bad. Jeff Bridges is The Dude, literally. I find it very strange that the hero of this story is a loafer who just wants to drink White Russians, get stoned, and bowl, but it works a treat. I found myself getting caught up in their world. John goodman played a great role as The Dude's friend Walter and Steve Buscemi filled the part of poor old Donny. The story is humorous throughout although brief sadness is found, but even this is used to humorous effect. Okay it isn't one of the most intricately woven plots ever but the dialogue is expertly written and the characters superb. I recommend this film to anyone who is a Coen brother's fan (that really goes without saying) and anyone who sees a bit of The Dude in themselves (which, if we were honest might be a lot of us) oh, and anyone who likes cool movies.

Author: 6 August 2002
Review_Url: It's all been said before, so to summarize:

Author: 16 August 2002
Review: 'you are entering a world of pain!'
Review_Url: i asked myself recently, out of all the four hundred or so films that i own, which ONE couldn't i live with out. The Big Lebowski was the answer. The Coen brothers are in a league of their own when it comes to quality control. Everything about this film oozes class, and style, from the opening title sequences, surreal dreams(flashbacks!) and some imaginitive camera work. Good use of colour as well, check out  the bowling balls and the 'Jesus's suit. It's also very, very funny, and the whole of the cast are at their best!

Author: 30 July 2020
Review: He could be my best friend.
Review_Url: He could be my best friend. Jeff Bridges is so good in this film which makes it ridiculous. He's the dude. End of story. Bowling, carpet, milk, White Russian... Those are things have stayed all these years. It's brilliant.

Author: 17 June 2010
Review: Johnathan Taylor Thomas' "Man Of The House" does not have sh_t on this!
Review_Url: Every now and then in a lifetime something called The Big Lebowski comes rolling into my sick world. The film follows the story of a disillusioned Eagles obsessive by the name of Jeff Bridges who's tubwaggled into a world of stolen cars, blown toe-nails, and marmots. Once satisfied to idolize Richard Nixon to the tune of an all Eagles soundtrack the Dude finds himself tugged crotch first into a world of international intrigue. Supporting roles includes a militant Rosie O'Donnel as The Dude's brother in law and shooting partner Walter and Steve Buscemi as Creedence fan John Turturro. In short this film is perfect for anyone who harbors a love for The Eagles, Bowling, and White Russians. Take er' easy dude!

Author: 26 April 2005
Review_Url: In their career Coen brothers won't again reach the high who they released with this movie . Movie based over the vagabond brain of Dude and the ironic and without a possible description of the "jew" Walter , but rarely a movie can be remembered for his superb dialogs and sentences as : "THIS AGGRESSION WILL NOT STAND, MAN." "THE BUMS WILL ALWAYS LOSE!" "HAVE YOU EVER HEARD|OF Vietnam?" "YOU'RE ENTERING|A WORLD OF PAIN, SON." and many others . It's as to describe a landscape colored with millions of colors , a way to walk in an alien heaven , it's how life should be but the potential is it's how life "might be" . Kind of humans with their low vision of this world would not spend a cent as they wouldn't break their ordinary world of fear , fear watching a person who does change own world without pretending to change anything , an anonymous sequence of d.n.a. binary in a world ever biggest than the day before , and Dude swims in this anonymous world , escaping from sharks , humans which lost from their born that free state primitive painted by J.J.Rousseau in Emile . Anything of this movie is a huge smile and a long and bitter laugh about this occidental society .

Author: 5 March 2021
Review: Exceptional... am I wrong... AM I WRONG!
Review_Url: If you're lucky enough to have never seen this film before, you're in for a treat. It's one of the greatest pieces of cinema, a true classic. The Coen brothers are legends and this is one of their best. Bridges and Goodman are top of their game. Do you know what, I'm going to watch it again right now, for about the hundredth time!

Author: 26 September 2013
Review_Url: What makes this an outstanding comedy?!? The fact that you laugh louder the 4th time, the 5th time you watch it. It's not only a comedy of punch lines (when you enjoy it the 1st time, then the 2nd time it's not that funny, cause you already know the catch). It's the classical style of the movie's atmosphere that sets the adorable mood.

Author: 2 October 2018
Review_Url: I haven't cracked up more during a movie than this one. The situations will make you cringe and the characters are so unique and readily identifiable. Definitely worth a watch - still can't believe it was released 20 years ago!

Author: 28 January 1999
Review_Url: For a long time my mind was divided between: Monty Python's the life of Brian or Monty pythons search for the holy grail as the funniest film ever. After seeing this latest Coen bros. production, I've had to change my mind. The drugs...the sex...the bowling and the carpet... All summed up when Goodman, looking very unimpressed, turns to the dude and says: "eight years old Dude, eight years old!"

Author: 3 October 1999
Review: I had expected more from the Coen brothers...
Review_Url: Two of my favorite movies are Raising Arizona and The Hudsucker Proxy, and Fargo was pretty good too. I expected a lot from this movie but was somewhat disapointed. The plot was harder to follow than their other movies, and after seeing it twice it still seems kinda stupid. There were too many groups working against and with each other to really pull the end together smoothly. I think there was a lot of great acting, but it didn't really help the movie. But I think they are coming out with a new movie soon, so maybe it will turn out better...

Author: 30 June 1999
Review: A strange, but very funny movie.
Review_Url: This movie is great!!!  This movie is about "Dude" Lebowski and his friends, who unwittingly get involved in a kidnapping plot.

Author: 28 August 1999
Review_Url: I am not a fun of coen brothers, in fact i don't like their films. but big lebowski is really the best film of the season, Bridges/Goodman are really magnificent, also other players (especially John Turturro) are superb too. the only compliant i may have is Julianne Moore, she sucks! Great players (except jm), great performances (except guess who?), great film, ah and really great music. Don't miss this Coen masterpiece!

Author: 17 March 2000
Review: Don't listen to the critics , GO SEE IT !!
Review_Url: Another great movie from the Coen brothers . Even though I've seen it al least 5 times there's still parts that I can't figure out . Anyway John Goodman steals the show (again) . The film is full of laughs with the best line being "you want a toe , shit I can get you one by 3 o'clock , with tail polish " . Don't wast more time reading this , just get in on video or DVD.

Author: 1 July 2001
Review: One of the best films of the nineties!
Review_Url: In 100 years time the Coen brothers will be remembered for Fargo as their 'classic' film, but their most celebrated film is not their best, Lebowski is the king of funny films. Personnally I find nothing amusing about slapstick comedy, the beauty of Lebowski(and all genuinly funny films, Dr Strangelove, Withnail and I, Annie Hall)is that it uses well crafted characters, intelligence and/or stupidity for reaching the child within. Lines such as "she's gotta feed the monkey" are just so off the wall that it never fails raise giggles, smirks and riotous rolling on the floor. The Dude and Walter are one of the best double acts I've ever witnessed, up there with Lemon and Curtis in Some like it Hot or Laural and Hardy. While critics are afraid to praise new films and rank them with the so called classics, I believe the Coen's will be remembered for this as well as Fargo, the same way that Orson Welles is remembered for Citizen Kane AND THEN Touch of Evil. Fargo AND THEN The Big Lebowski(which is much better!!)

Author: 5 July 2000
Review: If you will it dude, such a great movie is no dream
Review_Url: Since I saw The Big Lebowski for the first time in the movie theaters over two years ago (I saw it twice in the theaters), I have probably watched it between 50-75 times.  I was awed by the overall atmosphere the movie conveyed upon first viewing, and was shocked that every subsequent time I saw it, it just got better and better.  Even to this today, I notice something new and different upon each viewing.

Author: 4 May 2001
Review_Url: I have seen this movie more than a dozen times, I often just play it on the DVD while I am doing something else... why?  ....Well,... ...this movie is unlike any other one I have ever watched.  You cannot really categorize it in a particular genre!  It is unique, it is funny, the performances are outstanding and the story line is very original.  The best thing about the story itself is its simplicity (for the lack of a better word).  This movie does not try to teach us, or get a point across, it is just about dude's life who enjoys doing nothing.  Now the Coens took dude's life and turned it to one of the funniest, wittiest and most amusing movie of all times.  The soundtrack complements the story very well (the Coens always seem to have the perfect touch for their soundtrack choice) and Sam Elliot's voice for the narration was the perfect choice. That being said I just have to watch the movie again.....

Author: 15 August 2002
Review: This aggression will not stand, man!
Review_Url: Oh, so many great lines. The beauty of this is in the subtleties - the Dude hears something somewhere, doesn't really understand what it means, but uses it in conversation. "This aggression will not stand" he gets from George Bush and uses it on the Big Lebowski. "The parlance of our times" he steals from Maude and uses it on Brandt and the Big Lebowski. On and on.
